info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 4:39PM EDT until May 16 at 9:08PM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania...
East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County.
For the Brandywine Creek...including Downingtown...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring.
* WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek below Downingtown.
* WHEN...Until late this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM EDT Friday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 PM EDT Friday was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 7.8 feet late this afternoon. It will fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.9 feet on 08/19/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 915 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING
